title: How to Survive a Call of Cthulhu Adventure

steps.headline: Remember, this is all for in-game only; don't do this in real life!
Put points into skills THAT ARE USEFUL.
steps.description: (i.e. Spot Hidden, Listen, Combat Skills, First Aid, etc.). Ensure that someone has a high skill in Library Use. Consider the team skills; for instance, only  one person need know Ancient Egyptian.

steps.headline: Research the town before investigating.
steps.description: Use the local library, town hall, newspapers, and court records.

steps.headline: Go to any suspicious places and spend the night.
steps.description: If you hear sounds which do not sound like movement, feel free to send two people to scout. One person should look, the other should not look - only watch his back. If you feel you hear non-humanoid movement, flee immediately.

steps.headline: Do not try to fight monsters.
If you feel you cannot defeat the monster, run.
steps.description: It may be your only choice.

steps.headline: Going home is your easiest route to survival.

tyn: A light source, torch, flashlight, etc.
Common sense (harder to find than you would think...)
Shotguns (for when things get really sticky)
Sawed off Shotguns, Browning Automatic Rifles, and Thompson Sub Machine guns are very effective weapons.
text: Remember, this is all for in-game only; don't do this in real life!  Put points into skills THAT ARE USEFUL. (i.e. Spot Hidden, Listen, Combat Skills, First Aid, etc.). Ensure that someone has a high skill in Library Use. Consider the team skills; for instance, only  one person need know Ancient Egyptian. Research the town before investigating. Use the local library, town hall, newspapers, and court records. Always go in groups.  Arm yourself.  Ask many, many questions.  Go to any suspicious places and spend the night. If you hear sounds which do not sound like movement, feel free to send two people to scout. One person should look, the other should not look - only watch his back. If you feel you hear non-humanoid movement, flee immediately. Do not try to fight monsters. Ever. Do not trust main characters.  If you feel you cannot defeat the monster, run. It may be your only choice. Going home is your easiest route to survival.
